title: Adaptive Noise Resilient Keyword Spotting Using One-Shot Learning
author: Luciano Sebastian Martinez-Rau (Mid Sweden University), Quynh Nguyen Phuong Vu (Mid Sweden University), Yuxuan Zhang (Mid Sweden University), Bengt Oelmann (Mid Sweden University), Sebastian Bader (Mid Sweden University), ...
relevance_why: The approach uses one-shot learning for noise adaptation, which can inspire less resource-intensive methods in audio processing tasks, enhancing adaptability in real-world scenarios.
background: Developing a keyword spotting system that can effectively adapt to changing noise conditions in real-time with minimal data requirements.
contribution: This paper introduces a low-complexity method for continuous noise adaptation using one-shot learning to enhance performance in noisy environments.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods for keyword spotting often required extensive data and longer training times to achieve robustness against noise.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work reduces the data and computation required for adaptation, allowing for rapid adaptation with only one example and one training epoch.

key_innovation: The utilization of one-shot learning for transferring noise resilience to pretrained models significantly decreases resource needs, making it suitable for embedded systems.
real_world_impact: This approach can lead to more reliable keyword spotting systems in everyday devices, enhancing user experience in noisy environments where traditional systems fail.
limitations: No explicit limitations mentioned by the authors.

new_terms.one-shot learning: **One-shot learning** is a type of machine learning where the model learns information about object categories from a very small number of training samples, often just one.
